page.title: 08Ironville then and now
page.content: Ironville in 1919 was a self contained model village built for local workers inthe middle of the last century.It had its own elementary school,with 3 head teachers,a church,gas and water works, and Mechanics Institute.In 1953 Coronation year they had a big bonfire to celebrate the queens crowning.The village had grown in size because houses had been built around the old village. Now the old centre of the village has been re developed with a new shopping centre and the older houses modernised.The village is still mostly self contained although people now travel to work and shop.
